alpnPolicy.description: Name of the Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation (ALPN) policy. Can be set if `protocol` is `TLS`. Valid values are `HTTP1Only`, `HTTP2Only`, `HTTP2Optional`, `HTTP2Preferred`, and `None`.

arn.description:
ARN of the target group.

The following arguments are optional:

certificateArn.description: ARN of the default SSL server certificate. Exactly one certificate is required if the protocol is HTTPS. For adding additional SSL certificates, see the `aws.lb.ListenerCertificate` resource.

defaultActions.description: Configuration block for default actions. Detailed below.

loadBalancerArn.description:
ARN of the load balancer.

The following arguments are optional:

mutualAuthentication.description: The mutual authentication configuration information. Detailed below.

port.description: Port on which the load balancer is listening. Not valid for Gateway Load Balancers.

protocol.description: Protocol for connections from clients to the load balancer. For Application Load Balancers, valid values are `HTTP` and `HTTPS`, with a default of `HTTP`. For Network Load Balancers, valid values are `TCP`, `TLS`, `UDP`, and `TCP_UDP`. Not valid to use `UDP` or `TCP_UDP` if dual-stack mode is enabled. Not valid for Gateway Load Balancers.

sslPolicy.description: Name of the SSL Policy for the listener. Required if `protocol` is `HTTPS` or `TLS`.

tags.description:
A map of tags to assign to the resource. .If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

> **NOTE::** Please note that listeners that are attached to Application Load Balancers must use either `HTTP` or `HTTPS` protocols while listeners that are attached to Network Load Balancers must use the `TCP` protocol.

tagsAll.description: A map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider `default_tags` configuration block.

certificateArn.description: ARN of the default SSL server certificate. Exactly one certificate is required if the protocol is HTTPS. For adding additional SSL certificates, see the `aws.lb.ListenerCertificate` resource.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Listener resources.
